identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

abstract.p: Boutique Calypso sells collection of finger puppets and donates part of profits to Children's Aid Society; photo (Pulse column) (S)

block.p: The latest sell-out item at Calypso, a high-end chain of boutiques known for French Riviera-inspired tunics and beaded skirts, is not a new kurta or a tissue-weight cashmere sweater, but a collection of finger puppets. The droll puppets, made in a variety of bright salon and Liberty prints, were created to benefit the Children's Aid Society, which is to receive 50 percent of the profits. Choose from a menagerie of five: monkey, elephant, lion, rabbit and donkey. At $5 each, it's tempting to pick up the entire set. Orders: www.calypso-celle.com.
